text: Wow, I looked at his resume.... just why did he stop composing music? I can't believe he composed all these amazing tracks in the 80s (and early 90s) and then stopped completely. I would love to hear new material from him!

text:
I can't believe thatit took you this long to upload this classic! ^_^

Btw, the blue hair is a re-occuring theme for many NES titles since they use a black background, the character would look like a maniac without visible hair =)

author: SupraDarky

text:
This is apparently where Wario first appeared too. His Wikipedia article has an interesting section on his Concept and Creation
en.wikipedia. org/wiki/Wario#Concept_and_creation

His name is also a japanese pun, in a way. Warui means bad, and his japanese name was Warui Mario. I stole that from Did You Know Gaming's most recent post though
didyouknowgaming. com/post/40872967293/super-mario-bros-and-wario

author: tttc

text: Tanaka with one of his many memorable themes. This game's a classic, you basically have to break everything that can be broken while escaping from monsters and fireballs. It's an arcade style game where you just want to reach the highest score possible. Some of you might have recognized this theme from its appeareance in Smash Brawl. Also, Mario looked a bit sick on that boxart, and what's with the blue hair?
author: SupraDarky
